chargeHist.descr: Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order
Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Intentionally Give False Alarm, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.13.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined on December 9, 2022.

-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments, and restitution to be paid, including DNA surcharge, during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-No contact with victims; D.A., J.K.S., S.A., J.M.I., H.J.K., J.F.K.A., Katz Properties building at 1041 E. Knapp St., JETZ convenience store at 1425 N. Farwell Ave.
-No contact with firearms.

-Milwaukee Day Reporting Center; follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Anger management; follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Vocational Training.
-Provide DNA Sample.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia Kathryne Malone

records.addlTxt: Case referred back to Court. (RESOLVED)

Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Patricia Kathryne Malone.  Attorney Dax Odom appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 5 AND 6.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1, 2, 3, 4, 7 AND 8.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty AS AMENDED and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement made by J.M.I. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to COUNTS 2 and 3, with credit for 70 days served. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to COUNTS 1 and 3. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 3.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to COUNTS 1 and 2. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 4.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to all other counts and case 22CF3169. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 7.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent to all other counts and case 22CF3169. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 8.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to all other counts and case 22CF3169. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-30 DAYS in House of Correction as Condition Time; concurrent to all other counts and case 22CF3169. Court IMPOSE AND STAYED; to be used as determined by the agent.
-Milwaukee Day Reporting Center; follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Anger management; follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment. 
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; random urine screens and breathalyzers. 
-No contact with victims; D.A., J.K.S., S.A., J.M.I., H.J.K., J.F.K.A., Katz Properties building at 1041 E. Knapp St., JETZ convenience store at 1425 N. Farwell Ave.
-Vocational Training.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution to be determined at a later date.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments, and restitution to be paid, including DNA surcharge, during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 36; IN PERSON. Restitution hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury instructions for plea; Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Patricia Kathryne Malone.  Attorney Dax Odom in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a bail bond hearing on defense's motion to modify bail. Statements made by Victims JI and JS. Arguments heard. Statement made by the defendant. Based on the information and statements placed on the record, Bail motion by defense denied by the Court. Defense requests a status date. Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Patricia Kathryne Malone appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Robakawski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Bail Bond Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, by zoom, defendant Patricia Kathryne Malone not in court, in custody.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin; J. I. appeared by zoom.  
Case in court for return on warrant.  Court hears arguments as to bail.  For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail.  Cash Bond set at $1000.00.  All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue.  State to file modified no contact order.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on August 10, 2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until August 16, 2022 at 1:30 PM for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Parties notified of next court date.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appeare, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
